description:
Actinomycetospora aurantiaca is a species of bacterium that belongs to the phylum Actinobacteria. It is a Gram-positive, aerobic, and spore-forming microorganism. The cells of Actinomycetospora aurantiaca are typically rod-shaped and exhibit a characteristic orange or reddish-orange pigmentation.

This species is known to be found in various soil and environmental samples, particularly in areas with high organic matter content. Actinomycetospora aurantiaca is capable of degrading complex organic compounds, making it an important contributor to the cycling of nutrients in the environment.

The genome of Actinomycetospora aurantiaca has been sequenced, providing insights into its metabolic capabilities and potential roles in various ecological processes. Further research on this species may contribute to our understanding of the diversity and functional roles of Actinobacteria in terrestrial ecosystems.
